page.title: 05Farming Near Burscough(cont)
page.content: The recent drainage system is part of the Lancashire River Board River Crossens Land Drainage Scheme. Officialy opened in 1961.It pumps water into the Irish Sea at Crossens and can maintain the water table at three different levels in three separate areas.Drainage problems have been made worse in the few years due to increased run-off from the increase in built up area nearby. By placeing perforated plastic pipes up to five foot below soil suface(depth needed to be undisturbed by ploughing) water is drained away to a central ditch and pumped to Crossens.The crops grown include carrots,barley,peas and potatoes.These are grown in rotation to help preserve the condition of crops.Potatoes are only one year in six to prevent spread of potato root eel worm,which has reduced production.
